Find, for all large $n$, a non-trivial pairwise balanced block design $A_1,\ldots,A_m\subseteq \{1,\ldots,n\}$ such that, for all $t$, there are $O(n^{1/2})$ many $i$ such that $\lvert A_i\rvert=t$.



$A_1,\ldots,A_m$ is a pairwise balanced block design if every pair in $\{1,\ldots,n\}$ is contained in exactly one of the $A_i$.

Erd\H{o}s \cite{Er81} writes 'this will be probably not be very difficult to prove but so far I was not successful'.

Erd\H{o}s and de Bruijn \cite{dBEr48} proved that if $A_1,\ldots,A_m\subseteq \{1,\ldots,n\}$ is a pairwise balanced block design then $m\geq n$, and this implies there must be some $t$ such that there are $\gg n^{1/2}$ many $t$ with $\lvert A_i\rvert=t$.




References


[Er81] Erd\H{o}s, P., On the combinatorial problems which I would most like to see solved. Combinatorica (1981), 25-42.

[dBEr48] de Bruijn, N. G. and Erd\H{o}s, P., On a combinatorial problem. Nederl. Akad. Wetensch., Proc. (1948), 1277--1279 = Indagationes Math. 10, 421--423.
